definition: to deserve
surname Ying
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
to deserve what one gets (punishment, mishap etc) (idiom)

sentences.english: But they are willing to teach even though they're not getting paid what they should get paid.
sentences.chinese: 他們還是願意去教，雖然他們並沒得到應得的報酬。

sentences.english: The jury sided with Christofferson-Titchbourne, awarding her thirty-nine million dollars.
sentences.chinese: 陪審團站在朱莉一邊，判她應得3900萬美元。

sentences.english: And you're thinking - at last, they get their comeuppance.
sentences.chinese: 你或許在想，他們總算是罪有應得了。

sentences.english: Mercy means God holds back the condemnation we deserve.
sentences.chinese: 上帝收回我們應得的責罰，這就是他的仁慈。

sentences.english: Apply your ideas with patience for the reward they may deserve.
sentences.chinese: 運用您的主意和耐心歸報他們應得的報應。

sentences.english: Should we really consider them well-earned?
sentences.chinese: 可我們真該覺得這些金牌都是贏得應得嗎？

sentences.english: He observed that honours do not always went to those who deserved them.
sentences.chinese: 他說榮譽並非總是爲應得的人所得。

sentences.english: The salaries due to the employees will be paid this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 僱員們應得的工資將在今天下午付給他們。

sentences.english: Gaining what I desire without losing what I should gain.
sentences.chinese: 以不失去應得之物爲前提獲得所想之物。

sentences.english: I suppose you're here to collect the reward for killing those murlocs?
sentences.chinese: 我想你來這裏是爲了拿回死死魚人所應得的獎勵吧？

sentences.english: Any such provocations cannot get away without due punishment.
sentences.chinese: 凡屬這類挑釁都逃不脫應得的懲罰。

sentences.english: The American people are finally going to get the explanation they deserve.
sentences.chinese: 美國人民終於將得到他們應得的解釋了。

sentences.english: And remember to use only the respectful words I deserve so well.
sentences.chinese: 請記住使用我應得的敬語。

sentences.english: That's an antecedent standard. Moral desert.
sentences.chinese: 道德應得，那是一個先行標準。

sentences.english: What is the difference between moral deserts and entitlements?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，道義缺失與應得權利之間的區別呢？

definition: variant of 給予|给予[ji3 yu3]
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to turn a blind eye to
reward/remuneration
to take troubles to heart (idiom); brooding
to offer evidence
to give up/to abandon/to abort
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to reckon/to calculate/to plan/to expect/to scheme
penalty/punishment/to punish
to reform and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
to abandon/to desert/to renounce
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
to dispute/to refute
